name: Force html edit
author: magnetik

sections.description: Force HTML edition for specific posts via a checkbox (In other words, WYSIWYG editor is not available for a (or some) post/page that you define). See screenshots.
sections.installation:
1. Upload force-html-edit folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. That’s it !
sections.faq:
Where is this option ?

The option should be located on the right side under the “Save” box on every page/post edit.
Look at screenshots !

Other question ?

Contact me via comments : http://magnetik.org/tech/wordpress/force-html-edition/

description: Force HTML edition for specific posts via a checkbox (In other words, WYSIWYG editor is not available for a (or some) post/page that you define). See screenshots.

screenshots.caption: Location of the "Force html edition" option.
With option activated you (or other editors) can't access the WYSIWYG.
